meanings.definition: Free from extremes of variation in temperature.
meanings.sent1: The equable weather in this region makes it a popular tourist destination.
meanings.sent2: The equable climate in the coastal area is perfect for growing certain crops.
meanings.sent3: The equable temperature outside was so pleasant that it put everyone in a good mood.
meanings.sent4: Her equable demeanor was like a soothing balm in the midst of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The equable weather conditions made the outdoor wedding a delightful experience for all.

meanings.definition: Not easily disturbed or angered; calm and even-tempered.
meanings.sent1: Despite the stressful situation, she remained equable and handled it with grace.
meanings.sent2: His equable nature made him a great mediator in conflicts among his friends.
meanings.sent3: Even when faced with criticism, he stayed equable and focused on improving himself.
meanings.sent4: Her equable response to the rude comments surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The equable attitude of the teacher helped diffuse the tension in the classroom.
